reviewText: The fifth episode of this fourth season, PLAYBACK, was broadcasted on March 2nd, 1975. It's also possible to watch this episode in the DVD standard by purchasing Columbo - The Complete Fourth Season. For his work in this episode, Richard C. Glouner earned the 1975 Emmy award in the Outstanding Achievement in Cinematography for Entertainment Programming for a Series category. After Columbo Collector's Edition: Death Lends A Hand and Columbo Collector's Edition (An Exercise in Fatality), PLAYBACK is already the third episode directed by Bernard L. Kowalski, the revered director of Sssssss. Two "cream of the crop" guest stars in this episode; Oskar Werner, the unforgettable hero of Franois Truffaut masterpieces Jules and Jim - Criterion Collection and Fahrenheit 451 and Gena Rowlands, one of the ten best American actresses of the last 40 years. A VHS to keep in your library.

Guest stars include Oskar Werner, Gena Rowlands, Robert Brown, Patricia Barry, and Martha Scott. This is said to be one of Columbo's own favorite episodes. The story of this episode is the electronics business and a family squabble. In this episode Columbo gets the idea to solve the murder while watching an instant replay during a televised football game.
